conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph of Car A and Car B.
The graph shows two curves representing the velocities of Car A and Car B over time from t=0 to t=t1.
The curve for Car A starts higher and gradually decreases in slope, indicating decreasing acceleration.
The curve for Car B starts lower and gradually increases in slope, indicating increasing acceleration.
Car A’s velocity decreases from v2 to v1 as time increases.
Car B’s velocity increases from v1 to v2 as time increases.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity, determined from the slope of the v-t graph.
For Car A: The slope of its velocity-time graph decreases, meaning the acceleration is decreasing.
For Car B: The slope of its velocity-time graph increases, meaning the acceleration is increasing.
During the period from t=0 to t=t1, Car A has decreasing acceleration while Car B has increasing acceleration.
